newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey tight-lipped on Simitis win in Greece.
newsitem.headline: Turkey tight-lipped on Simitis win in Greece.

text.p: Turkey said on Monday it had no comment to make on the re-election of Prime Minister Costas Simitis in arch-rival Greece but the Turkish press hailed it as a victory for peace.
"The elections are something that concern the Greek people themselves so we have no comment on that," foreign ministry spokesman Sermet Atacanli told a news briefing.
Socialist Simitis had a strong win in Sunday's polls over conservative Miltiades Evert, regarded in Turkey as a hawk.
"Simitis wins, warmonger Evert resigns," the Hurriyet daily said in a front-page headline. Evert said on Sunday he would resign as leader of the conservative New Democracy party after his defeat.
Evert had promised to take a tough line against neighbour and NATO ally Turkey. The two countries are at odds over sovereignty in the Aegean Sea, the divided island of Cyprus and minority rights.
Greece and Turkey almost came to blows in January in a dispute over uninhabited islets in the Aegean that was defused by Washington.
